  19. (* Specific operations for the ARM processor, 64-bit mode *)

  21. open Format

  23. ‌let macosx = (Config.system = "macosx")

  25. (* Machine-specific command-line options *)

  27. ‌let command_line_options = []

  29. (* Addressing modes *)

  31. ‌type addressing_mode =
  32.   | Iindexed of int                     (* reg + displ *)
  33.   | Ibased of string * int              (* global var + displ *)

  35. (* We do not support the reg + shifted reg addressing mode, because
  36.    what we really need is reg + shifted reg + displ,
  37.    and this is decomposed in two instructions (reg + shifted reg -> tmp,
  38.    then addressing tmp + displ). *)

  40. (* Specific operations *)

  42. ‌type cmm_label = int
  43.   (* Do not introduce a dependency to Cmm *)

  45. ‌type specific_operation =
  46.   | Ifar_poll of { return_label: cmm_label option }
  47.   | Ifar_alloc of { bytes : int; dbginfo : Debuginfo.alloc_dbginfo }
  48.   | Ifar_intop_checkbound
  49.   | Ifar_intop_imm_checkbound of { bound : int; }
  50.   | Ishiftarith of arith_operation * int
  51.   | Ishiftcheckbound of { shift : int; }
  52.   | Ifar_shiftcheckbound of { shift : int; }
  53.   | Imuladd       (* multiply and add *)
  54.   | Imulsub       (* multiply and subtract *)
  55.   | Inegmulf      (* floating-point negate and multiply *)
  56.   | Imuladdf      (* floating-point multiply and add *)
  57.   | Inegmuladdf   (* floating-point negate, multiply and add *)
  58.   | Imulsubf      (* floating-point multiply and subtract *)
  59.   | Inegmulsubf   (* floating-point negate, multiply and subtract *)
  60.   | Isqrtf        (* floating-point square root *)
  61.   | Ibswap of int (* endianness conversion *)
  62.   | Imove32       (* 32-bit integer move *)
  63.   | Isignext of int (* sign extension *)

  65. ‌and arith_operation =
  66.     Ishiftadd
  67.   | Ishiftsub

  69. (* Sizes, endianness *)

  71. ‌let big_endian = false

  73. ‌let size_addr = 8
  74. ‌let size_int = 8
  75. ‌let size_float = 8

  77. ‌let allow_unaligned_access = false

  79. (* Behavior of division *)

  81. ‌let division_crashes_on_overflow = false

  83. (* Operations on addressing modes *)

  85. ‌let identity_addressing = Iindexed 0

  87. ‌let offset_addressing addr delta =
  88.   match addr with
  89.   | Iindexed n -> Iindexed(n + delta)
  90.   | Ibased(s, n) -> Ibased(s, n + delta)

  92. ‌let num_args_addressing = function
  93.   | Iindexed _ -> 1
  94.   | Ibased _ -> 0

  96. (* Printing operations and addressing modes *)

  98. ‌let print_addressing printreg addr ppf arg =
  99.   match addr with
  100.   | Iindexed n ->
  101.       printreg ppf arg.(0);
  102.       if n <> 0 then fprintf ppf " + %i" n
  103.   | Ibased(s, 0) ->
  104.       fprintf ppf "\"%s\"" s
  105.   | Ibased(s, n) ->
  106.       fprintf ppf "\"%s\" + %i" s n

  108. ‌let print_specific_operation printreg op ppf arg =
  109.   match op with
  110.   | Ifar_poll _ ->
  111.     fprintf ppf "(far) poll"
  112.   | Ifar_alloc { bytes; } ->
  113.     fprintf ppf "(far) alloc %i" bytes
  114.   | Ifar_intop_checkbound ->
  115.     fprintf ppf "%a (far) check > %a" printreg arg.(0) printreg arg.(1)
  116.   | Ifar_intop_imm_checkbound { bound; } ->
  117.     fprintf ppf "%a (far) check > %i" printreg arg.(0) bound
  118.   | Ishiftarith(op, shift) ->
  119.       let op_name = function
  120.       | Ishiftadd -> "+"
  121.       | Ishiftsub -> "-" in
  122.       let shift_mark =
  123.        if shift >= 0
  124.        then sprintf "<< %i" shift
  125.        else sprintf ">> %i" (-shift) in
  126.       fprintf ppf "%a %s %a %s"
  127.        printreg arg.(0) (op_name op) printreg arg.(1) shift_mark
  128.   | Ishiftcheckbound { shift; } ->
  129.       fprintf ppf "check %a >> %i > %a" printreg arg.(0) shift
  130.         printreg arg.(1)
  131.   | Ifar_shiftcheckbound { shift; } ->
  132.       fprintf ppf
  133.         "(far) check %a >> %i > %a" printreg arg.(0) shift printreg arg.(1)
  134.   | Imuladd ->
  135.       fprintf ppf "(%a * %a) + %a"
  136.         printreg arg.(0)
  137.         printreg arg.(1)
  138.         printreg arg.(2)
  139.   | Imulsub ->
  140.       fprintf ppf "-(%a * %a) + %a"
  141.         printreg arg.(0)
  142.         printreg arg.(1)
  143.         printreg arg.(2)
  144.   | Inegmulf ->
  145.       fprintf ppf "-f (%a *f %a)"
  146.         printreg arg.(0)
  147.         printreg arg.(1)
  148.   | Imuladdf ->
  149.       fprintf ppf "%a +f (%a *f %a)"
  150.         printreg arg.(0)
  151.         printreg arg.(1)
  152.         printreg arg.(2)
  153.   | Inegmuladdf ->
  154.       fprintf ppf "(-f %a) -f (%a *f %a)"
  155.         printreg arg.(0)
  156.         printreg arg.(1)
  157.         printreg arg.(2)
  158.   | Imulsubf ->
  159.       fprintf ppf "%a -f (%a *f %a)"
  160.         printreg arg.(0)
  161.         printreg arg.(1)
  162.         printreg arg.(2)
  163.   | Inegmulsubf ->
  164.       fprintf ppf "(-f %a) +f (%a *f %a)"
  165.         printreg arg.(0)
  166.         printreg arg.(1)
  167.         printreg arg.(2)
  168.   | Isqrtf ->
  169.       fprintf ppf "sqrtf %a"
  170.         printreg arg.(0)
  171.   | Ibswap n ->
  172.       fprintf ppf "bswap%i %a" n
  173.         printreg arg.(0)
  174.   | Imove32 ->
  175.       fprintf ppf "move32 %a"
  176.         printreg arg.(0)
  177.   | Isignext n ->
  178.       fprintf ppf "signext%d %a"
  179.         n printreg arg.(0)

  181. (* Recognition of logical immediate arguments *)

  183. (* An automaton to recognize ( 0+1+0* | 1+0+1* )

  185.                0          1          0
  186.               / \        / \        / \
  187.               \ /        \ /        \ /
  188.         -0--> [1] --1--> [2] --0--> [3]
  189.        /
  190.      [0]
  191.        \
  192.         -1--> [4] --0--> [5] --1--> [6]
  193.               / \        / \        / \
  194.               \ /        \ /        \ /
  195.                1          0          1

  197. The accepting states are 2, 3, 5 and 6. *)

  199. ‌let auto_table = [|   (* accepting?, next on 0, next on 1 *)
  200.   (* state 0 *) (false, 1, 4);
  201.   (* state 1 *) (false, 1, 2);
  202.   (* state 2 *) (true,  3, 2);
  203.   (* state 3 *) (true,  3, 7);
  204.   (* state 4 *) (false, 5, 4);
  205.   (* state 5 *) (true,  5, 6);
  206.   (* state 6 *) (true,  7, 6);
  207.   (* state 7 *) (false, 7, 7)   (* error state *)
  208. |]

  210. ‌let rec run_automata nbits state input =
  211.   let (acc, next0, next1) = auto_table.(state) in
  212.   if nbits <= 0
  213.   then acc
  214.   else run_automata (nbits - 1)
  215.                     (if Nativeint.logand input 1n = 0n then next0 else next1)
  216.                     (Nativeint.shift_right_logical input 1)

  218. (* The following function determines a length [e]
  219.    such that [x] is a repetition [BB...B] of a bit pattern [B] of length [e].
  220.    [e] ranges over 64, 32, 16, 8, 4, 2.  The smaller [e] the better. *)

  222. ‌let logical_imm_length x =
  223.   (* [test n] checks that the low [2n] bits of [x] are of the
  224.      form [BB], that is, two occurrences of the same [n] bits *)
  225.   let test n =
  226.     let mask = Nativeint.(sub (shift_left 1n n) 1n) in
  227.     let low_n_bits = Nativeint.(logand x mask) in
  228.     let next_n_bits = Nativeint.(logand (shift_right_logical x n) mask) in
  229.     low_n_bits = next_n_bits in
  230.   (* If [test n] fails, we know that the length [e] is
  231.      at least [2n].  Hence we test with decreasing values of [n]:
  232.      32, 16, 8, 4, 2. *)
  233.   if not (test 32) then 64
  234.   else if not (test 16) then 32
  235.   else if not (test 8) then 16
  236.   else if not (test 4) then 8
  237.   else if not (test 2) then 4
  238.   else 2

  240. (* A valid logical immediate is
  241. - neither [0] nor [-1];
  242. - composed of a repetition [BBBBB] of a bit-pattern [B] of length [e]
  243. - the low [e] bits of the number, that is, [B], match [0+1+0*] or [1+0+1*].
  244. *)

  246. ‌let is_logical_immediate x =
  247.   x <> 0n && x <> -1n && run_automata (logical_imm_length x) 0 x

  249. (* Specific operations that are pure *)

  251. ‌let operation_is_pure = function
  252.   | Ifar_alloc _
  253.   | Ifar_intop_checkbound
  254.   | Ifar_intop_imm_checkbound _
  255.   | Ishiftcheckbound _
  256.   | Ifar_shiftcheckbound _ -> false
  257.   | _ -> true

  259. (* Specific operations that can raise *)

  261. ‌let operation_can_raise = function
  262.   | Ifar_alloc _
  263.   | Ifar_intop_checkbound
  264.   | Ifar_intop_imm_checkbound _
  265.   | Ishiftcheckbound _
  266.   | Ifar_shiftcheckbound _ -> true
  267.   | _ -> false
